TopicTitle: What would you like to unlearn?

Articles.Content:
A few versions ago I was docking together hugely inefficient ships in orbit and launching elaborate refueling mssions, just to get to another planet, and even then maybe need a rescue mission to get back.

Today I can get to anyplace in the system and back (well, maybe not Eve!) without refueling or orbital docking. I definitely had more fun when I couldn't even begin imagining doing that though. The game felt a lot bigger.

Anyhow, realising this got me thinking... What things do people most wish they could "unlearn" from Ksp" to make the game more fun?
Everything, i want to start from the beginning all over again.

Everything, i want to start from the beginning all over again.

Me too. Even though I've had the game for only half a year, those first few days were by far the best.
Nothing. Well, except maybe everything running at half-speed being the norm. Too many parts and not enough CPU!

I'd like to unlearn how to develop and use a consistent launcher. I've been using the same rocket (and a couple variants) since 0.18 at least and it's gotten kind of boring. While I am planning on developing a new launcher because of the flaws of the original, I miss the challenge of coming up with a new rocket for stuff.
All but what quicksaving is(It took me nearly 6 months before someone pointed it out)

Everything, i want to start from the beginning all over again.

Same. Except I'd like to keep my knowledge about shift and control controlling the throttle. When I first tried the demo a long time ago I didn't understand that and gave up. Though the 50% default throttle would probably fix that.
If there were life support requirements, realistic interactions with atmospheres, etc, I'd image a lot of people would have to unlearn a lot of things.
Right from the beginning. I remember the feeling of getting my first rocket into orbit. and then pondered on how I would get it to come back down
